course_title: Applications of Public Health Economics in Low & Moderate Income Countries
course_description: Prerequisites: GH 500 or GH 501. This course is an applied course that uses economic theory and concepts to focus on critical public health issues in low and moderate income countries, particularly focusing on public goods, their use and provision. We will also apply evolving theories of behavioral economics to decisions faced by individuals and households in very resource constrained environments using examples and cases from sub-Saharan Africa, Latin America, south and central Asia where the greatest proportion of those living in absolute poverty reside.
sections: Class Nbr: 5023, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 10:10a-12p, Instructor: D. McFarland, Status: Open
